channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: DA criticizes killing of black man by US police and says charges could come this week
item.description: The death of a black man at the hands of police reignited protests Saturday night in Atlanta, where hundreds blocked a major interstate, a fast-food restaurant was set ablaze and authorities responded with tear gas.

item.title: Anti-racist protests continue to spread worldwide
100 arrests after far-right groups target London protests
item.description: Far-right groups bombarded police with bottles and occasionally scuffled violently with officers as they staged a counter-protest to anti-racism Black Lives Matter (BLM) demonstrations in central London.

item.title: Cases surge in some US states
item.description: The number of coronavirus cases and hospitalizations have gone up in some states, a bleak reminder that the pandemic that's infected more than 2 million people is not over.

item.title: This could be the next major US retailer facing bankruptcy
item.description: With more than 10 million men out of work and millions more working from home, perhaps indefinitely, this is not the best time to be selling men's dress clothes.

item.title: The families stuck on different sides of the world by the pandemic
Cathartic acts of rage, or the rewriting of history? How statues became political lightning rods
item.description: • These are the confederate statues coming down

item.title: Online casinos catering to Chinese gamblers are causing kidnappings and chaos
Trump looks out of touch now, but it's too early to say he's doomed in November
item.description: • President makes rare retreat • ANALYSIS: Trump's poll ratings are low • Biden urged to pick a black woman as running mate

item.title: Nationwide protests grip Lebanon as currency tanks
item.description: Anti-government protesters took to the streets in multiple Lebanese urban centers on Thursday, setting up burning barricades and forcing road closures as the country's currency fell rapidly.

item.title: Woman hatches ducklings from supermarket eggs
item.description: A British woman has hatched three ducklings she named Beep, Peep and Meep from eggs she bought at supermarket chain Waitrose.

item.title: Fox News publishes digitally altered and misleading images of Seattle demonstrations
item.description: Fox News published digitally altered and misleading images on its website's homepage Friday that made a demonstration in Seattle, in which a group of largely peaceful Black Lives Matter protesters have occupied six city blocks, appear violent and dangerous.

item.title: How a new kind of policing saved America's most dangerous city
Stunning images show how virus is overrunning hospitals
item.description: CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports from Rio de Janeiro where coronavirus is overwhelming the hospitals and healthcare workers as Brazil nears the peak of its curve.

item.title: Why it's so hard not to be hugged
America's military leaders move on from Trump on racial inequality
Gas tanker explosion in China kills 19
item.description: At least 19 people died and 172 were injured when a gas tanker exploded on a Chinese highway Saturday afternoon, according to state-run news agency Xinhua.

item.title: Europeans forced to re-examine their colonial histories, national identities
item.description: At an old stone harbor in the English city of Bristol, young people gather at a bent railing by the water and peer into the murky deep. They're looking for the defaced statue of the 17th century slave trader Edward Colston. And just maybe, they're looking at an era gone by.

item.title: Rio cartels go from running drugs to pushing medication
item.description: Coronavirus rages on the edges of Rio de Janeiro -- in the hills and slums run by drug gangs, where police dare not go unless on an armed raid.

item.title: Lesotho former PM and wife paid criminal gang to execute his estranged wife, court papers say
item.description: Lesotho's ex-prime minister Thomas Thabane and his wife paid a local criminal gang to kill his estranged wife three years ago, according to recently released court documents.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
Woman caught on video harassing Filipino American woman exercising in park
item.description: A woman was caught on video harassing a Filipino American woman as she exercised this week at a Southern California park, the latest in a string of racist incidents captured on video and widely shared on social media.

item.title: 'I'm the same as everyone else': How albinism empowered a champion
item.description: You're at the top of a steep snow-capped mountain. You squint your eyes tightly -- almost to the point of blindness. Beneath you are two skis and the only way is down -- at a speed of over 80kmph.

item.title: Young Americans are having less sex than ever
item.description: Young Americans are having less sex -- and they can't even blame the coronavirus pandemic for this one.

item.title: 'You brought a huge smile to my face,' Prince Harry tells 95-year-old who walked for charity
item.description: Private Joseph Hammond, the 95-year-old Ghanaian man who walked 14 miles to raise money for frontline workers in Africa "brought a huge smile" to Prince Harry's face, he said in a letter to the war veteran.

item.title: Four poachers arrested in connection with the death of rare silverback gorilla Rafiki
item.description: Four poachers have been arrested in Uganda following the death of a rare silverback gorilla.

item.title: Tariq Mir, Jammu and Kashmir's Tyrion Lannister lookalike, dreams of Bollywood stardom
item.description: In the winter of 2018, actor Tariq Ahmad Mir was performing in a comedy skit to welcome visitors to the picturesque hill town of Pahalgam in the Indian-controlled region of Jammu and Kashmir.

item.title: 8 films to watch in a time of protest against systemic racism
item.description: Following the wave of demonstrations sparked by the killing of George Floyd, many of us have been thinking about the history of race in America, and the ongoing narrative of police violence. We are all looking for resources to help better understand the moment.

item.title: Poland invaded the Czech Republic last month, but says it was just a big misunderstanding
item.description: The Polish military has admitted it accidentally invaded the Czech Republic last month, but it insists its brief occupation of a small part of the country was simply a "misunderstanding."

item.title: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar's son arrested for allegedly stabbing neighbor
item.description: The son of NBA legend Kareem Abdul-Jabbar faces an assault with a deadly weapon charge after a stabbing incident in California.

item.title: US soccer star slams Trump: 'You're supposed to help ... not throw oil onto the fire'
Don Lemon reacts to comedian calling him out in Netflix special
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon reacts to Dave Chappelle mentioning him in his Netflix special after Lemon called for celebrities to use their platforms to speak out about the death of George Floyd.

item.title: Trump admin rolls back transgender health care protections during Pride Month
item.description: The Trump administration announced Friday it is eliminating an Obama-era regulation prohibiting discrimination in health care against patients who are transgender.

item.title: Woman launches racist rant in California park
item.description: A Filipino American woman was exercising in a park in Torrance, California when another woman passing by unleashed a racist tirade.

item.title: Starbucks reverses stance on Black Lives Matter apparel
item.description: Starbucks has reversed its prohibition on employees wearing Black Lives Matter apparel. CNN's Cristina Alesci explains why.

item.title: Airport offers 'pretend to go abroad' airport tours amid pandemic
item.description: With planes grounded and most tourism on hold during the coronavirus pandemic, one Taiwanese airport has come up with a unique solution to help citizens get their travel fix.

item.title: Death of black female essential worker at center of British BLM movement
item.description: Protesters across the UK are chanting for George Floyd as well Belly Mujinga, a black essential worker who died of Covid-19. Galvanized by the Black Lives Matter movement, her case has prompted more people in the UK to call for social justice. CNN's Salma Abdelaziz reports.

item.title: The Greek airport that was left to fall apart
item.description: After months of shutdown, Athens International Airport is gearing up to "welcome the world" once again as Greece moves ahead with plans to gradually lift coronavirus restrictions in a bid to revive its key tourism industry.

item.title: He spent over $1M on drugs before getting sober. Today, DJ Fat Tony still provides the soundtrack to London's party scene
item.description: One of the last parties that DJ Fat Tony played was Brooklyn Beckham's 21st birthday, held in a giant glass marquee at David and Victoria Beckham's family home in the English countryside. After that, he performed at legendary London venue Ministry of Sound. Then, the city went into lockdown.

item.title: 'Jaws,' the ultimate summer movie, meets the age of coronavirus
item.description: Remember the mayor in "Jaws," coaxing that family to go in the water, before they grab their raft and tentatively wade into the ocean? That image -- introduced 45 years ago this month -- keeps coming to mind as entertainment options, including movie theaters, gradually reopen in the age of coronavirus.

item.title: White celebrities take part in antiracism PSA; fans react
item.description: A group of white celebrities participated in a PSA vowing to "Take Responsibility" against racism. The video got mixed reactions on social media.

item.title: Listen to these artists for Black Music Month
item.description: June is Black Music Month and with all that's happening in our culture, the timing feels particularly strong.

item.title: Sedentary lockdowns put kids at risk for obesity. Here's how to help them stay moving
item.description: Canceled soccer practices. Shuttered dance rehearsals.

item.title: Luxury quarantining: Inside the Wyoming resort renting for $175,000 a week
item.description: Wyoming, with a population density of six people per square mile, may never have been more appealing as a vacation destination as it is now.

item.title: Quarantined cruise ship employee creates incredible outfits out of paper bags
item.description: Australian dancer Ashleigh Perrie was thrilled to start working on board the MS Zaandam. The cruise ship was due to travel through Antarctica -- past penguins and sea lions -- and onward to South America, while Perrie spent her days doing what she loved: performing.

item.title: Rescuers rush to sinking boat with nine people aboard
item.description: Rescuers saved nine people when a boat started to sink off the Florida coast.

item.title: Remember when the Beckhams went everywhere in matching outfits?
item.description: London's first digital fashion week kicks off today, offering an ideal opportunity to reflect on where British fashion is going -- and how far it has come.

item.title: Protester explains why only Wendy's was burned
CNN crew harassed and camera broken during protest
item.description: CNN's Natasha Chen recounts what she and her crew experienced while covering protests over the Atlanta police shooting death of Rayshard Brooks, a 27-year-old black man, at an area Wendy's restaurant.

item.title: How a new kind of policing saved America's most dangerous city
item.description: In the wake of the tragic murder of George Floyd, the City Council in Minneapolis announced that it will disband its police department. The decision aims to reverse the unacceptable status quo, and face the reality of decades of failed attempts to advance police reform.
